instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG? PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG is a single phase of CPU VCORE before it is combined into PPVCORE_S0_CPU .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fan spin no boot
threads.message:
howdy howdy howdy, I've got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that won't boot (no chime, no no-ram beep, no USB mouse lightup), PCH gets nice and toasty and is giving me trash instead of <SIGNAL>SPI_MLB_CLK</SIGNAL>. 

I assume the PCH is fucked, but I'd love for it not to be . help computah!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fan spin no boot
threads.message: History, liquid? Is CPU Vcore present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fan spin no boot
threads.message: wow, I would have sworn I checked already but I'm only .914v on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fan spin no boot
threads.message: I see no issue with that. What about my other question?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fan spin no boot
threads.message:
sorry, brain got retarded there and thought that was the problem.

power button LSI sensor hit, edge bonding gone from the GPU, flux under it. no clue about the history, I have a friend who is keeping an eye out for an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> for me and this is one he tracked down DOA. 

<CHIP>U4800</CHIP> area has a few darkened probe points below it, a bit of residue around battery connector, bios, and <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>. hmm, getting 2.7 on pin 4, and 3.28 on 5-8.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B fan spin no boot
threads.message: So this is a garbage board that was fucked with. GPU was messed with. Really this board could have so much wrong with it at this stage I doubt you want to waste time on this. If you really want to, first thing is to install a new GPU and probably VRAM. <CHIP>U4800</CHIP> is not important and if <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> had an issue it would not even power on. BIOS area is VERY important of course, so maybe look at that for corroded resistors and traces.
